result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kahla M. Irwin

records.addlTxt:
3:17 PM/ RM 203. Defendant Kahla M. Irwin appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail. Attorney Elizabeth Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Def. is representing herself in this matter and has filed a Waiver of Atty form which was accepted by Judge on August 3rd, 2022. Court questions if Def. would like to appear in person for P.H. or via zoom. Def. is okay to proceed via zoom. Court accepts Def. appearance via zoom. Def. wishes to proceed with P.H. Court accepts Def. Waiver of Atty. and will proceed with P.H. State is prepared to proceed with P.H. State calls first witness, Deputy Travis Krueger. Deputy Krueger sworn in under oath and testifies. Def. questions Deputy Krueger. State rests. State requests Court take judicial notice of case no. 22CF456, 21CF565 & 21CF502 and gives reasoning. Court reviews case history's in 22CF456, 21CF565 & 21CF502. Court questions State regarding testimony, State responds. Court takes judicial notice of case no 22CF456, 21CF565 & 21CF502. State gives argument and requests Court bind over for further proceedings. Def. gives argument. Court finds probable cause and binds over for further proceedings. State requests arraignment at a later date. Bond continues.
Arraignment scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:42 PM Room 203 Defendant Kahla M. Irwin appeared by video, in custody of LCSD. Attorney Kelly L Hays appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. All parties via Zoom. $2,000 current bond with conditions. Defendant gives bail bond argument. ADA gives bail bond argument and objects. Defendant gives response. Court makes statement. ADA responds. The Court questions defendant. Court gives ruling. Court denies bail bond request modification. Bond remains with conditions.1:48 PM off record.1:51 PM Back  on record. Preliminary hearing is scheduled on October 11, 2022 at 3:15 PM. Defendant questions the Court. Court recess at 1:52 PM. Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 11, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

for bond reduction (2)
Routed to Judge's JA

2:49 PM/Rm. 301/Defendant Kahla M. Irwin appeared by video, in custody at Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Kelly L Hays appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Parties and Court Reporter by Zoom.  Def. makes bond reduction request.  State objects and makes argument.  Court denies request for bail reduction.  Def. is representing herself and is waiting for offer from State.  Def. may renew request for bail reduction if this is going to trial.  Recess 2:55 p.m.
Bail/bond hearing on August 26, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

2:28 PM/Room 301. Prosecuting attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kahla M. Irwin appeared by video, in custody at Langlade County Jail by Zoom. Court reviews case history. Def. wishes to represent self. Waiver of attorney form reviewed. Court reviews charges and possible penalties. Def. wants to represent self. Court finds that Def. has waived counsel, finds competent and will allow to represent self. Court instructs Def. as to right to a preliminary hearing. Def. wants to waive time limits for P.H. Court accepts waiver of time limits. STC to be set. Def. wishes to have bond modification. Bond hearing already scheduled.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on August 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

regarding bond reduction 
(routed to CC's JA)

2:28 PM Defendant Kahla M. Irwin appeared by video, in custody, via zoom.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews history of case. Def. is eligible for P.D. and will continue without an atty today.  Court questions def. RE: atty rights. State explains rights to def. Court questions def. again RE rights. Def. wants to represent herself. Waiver form will be sent down to def. in jail for def.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

maintain absolute sobriety, no use or possession of alcohol, no illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no presence in establishments with Class B liquor license and no driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

1:07 PM Defendant Kahla M. Irwin appeared by video via Zoom.   Attorney Kelly L Hays appeared by video via Zoom for the State of Wisconsin. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Defendant plans to contact Public Defender. State gives bond recommendation of a cash bond of $3,000 with conditions of maintain absolute sobriety, no use of alcohol, no illegal use or possession of controlled substances, no presence in establishments with Class B liquor license and no driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant makes statement. Court orders a cash bail bond of $2,000 with conditions of maintain absolute sobriety, no use or possession of alcohol, no illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no presence in establishments with Class B liquor license and no driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Adjourned Initial Appearance is scheduled 7/25/22 at 1:30pm. Court is adjourned.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
